text:
Apache 2.0.48 loads Tomcat 4.1.10 via JK2 in-process just fine.  However, 
Tomcat 4.1.29 will not load.

Here's the contents of my stderr.log file.

TomcatStarter: main()
Try  org.apache.tomcat.startup.Main
Try  org.apache.catalina.startup.BootstrapService
Starting org.apache.catalina.startup.BootstrapService
Created catalinaLoader in: C:\Tomcat\server\lib
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/xml/sax/InputSource
	at java.lang.Class.newInstance0(Native Method)
	at java.lang.Class.newInstance(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.BootstrapService.init
(BootstrapService.java:201)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.BootstrapService.main
(BootstrapService.java:297)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)
	at org.apache.jk.apr.TomcatStarter.run(TomcatStarter.java:124)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
[INFO] AprImpl - -JK2: Initialized apr


Here's the contents of my workers2.properties file.

[vm:]
info=Parameters used to load a JVM in the server process
OPT=-Djava.class.path=${CATALINA_HOME}/bin/tomcat-
jni.jar;${CATALINA_HOME}/bin/BootStrap.jar;${CATALINA_HOME}/server/lib/commons-
logging.jar;${CATALINA_HOME}/server/lib/catalina.jar;${CATALINA_HOME}/server/lib
/commons-digester.jar;${CATALINA_HOME}/server/lib/mx4j-jmx.jar
OPT=-Dtomcat.home=${CATALINA_HOME}
OPT=-Dcatalina.home=${CATALINA_HOME}
OPT=-Xmx128M
#OPT=-Djava.compiler=NONE
disabled=0


I tried loading every JAR file from the Tomcat distributions common/lib, 
common/endorsed and server/lib directories without luck.
creator: dshort@san.rr.com
dshort@san.rr.com
text:
JK2 
Version 2.02 (Apache 2.0.43 and later)
Dated: 11/27/2002
Size: 148k

creator: dshort@san.rr.com
text:
I believe this is a JAR file issue.  As I add JAR files to the 
workers2.properties OPT=-Djava.class.path, the messages changes.  Can you 
please provide a complete list of the required JAR files.  Better yet, provide 
a CURRENT workers2.properties file.

creator: pr@webapp.de
text:
That correct in don't work. The Tomcat 4.1.29 based on newer JK2 Connector 
from Tomcat 5.0.16 and the have a JNI native work Bug.

I have spent a lot off time a copy older Jk2 2.0.2 jar to Tomcat 4.1.27 
server/lib and it works.

See http://tomcat.objektpark.org/devTipps.html ( only german sorry)

Peter

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
This component is now deprecated. If you still experience this issue, please 
upgrade to the Coyote JK2 connector.

No further work will take place against this bug report.
